text:
i.e. In Diff Eq. stiff refers to <https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stiff_equation> (i.e. equations are stiff, numbers are not usually called stiff)

As to your question: for parameters p in a function like `predatorprey!(du,  u, p, t)` usually the parameters `p`
 do not change during one run of the solve. But in SciML one of the goals is (in my understanding) to usually try to optimize p in a way. So p can change over several different runs so that it gets optimized

text: e.g. in your pendulum example. I could hard code the length of the rod into the equation, but that it inconvenient. I might want to have the length of the rod to be a parameter so I can quickly try out different rod lengths and see the results of the solve.

elements.text: e.g. in your pendulum example. I could hard code the length of the rod into the equation, but that it inconvenient. I might want to have the length of the rod to be a parameter so I can quickly try out different rod lengths and see the results of the solve.

text: thanks. yes i'm using stiffness incorrectly. i guess when i mean stiff i was really saying that the parameters change incredibly little wrt the variables and other parameters. but in real life everything is connected
